com.srch2.android.http.service

Class SRCH2Engine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.srch2.android.http.service.SRCH2Engine

  • public final class SRCH2Engine
extends Object
    This is the primary point of access for all of the functions of the SRCH2 Android SDK.

    All methods in this class are statically declared so that they may be called without having a reference to any instance. Note that any method that can be called on an instance of an Indexable, can be called statically on this class by using the name of the index that the Indexable represents.

    The search functionality of the SRCH2 Android SDK is powered by the running of the SRCH2 HTTP server. This server runs in its own process, and this process is started and stopped by the SRCH2Service remote service to insulate it from low-memory pressure. The SRCH2Engine starts and stops this service, which in turn starts and stops the SRCH2 search server. When SRCH2Engine.onStop(Context context) is called, the SRCH2 search server is not shut down immediately, but only after a delay in order to avoid unnecessary restarting in the event a user navigates away from the application using the SRCH2 Android SDK only to do some short task such as sending a text message.

    Since the SRCH2 search server is running as a RESTful HTTP server, any commands to the SRCH2 search server must be formed as network or RESTful actions. This class and the rest of the API wraps this condition of operation so that users of the SRCH2 Android SDK do not have to manually form their own network tasks but can instead simply make the appropriate calls on either the SRCH2Engine or their Indexable implementations. Similarly, the output of the SRCH2 search server is wrapped in the various subclasses of RestfulResponse so that the RESTful responses from the SRCH2 search server do not have to be parsed: for instance, after inserting a record, the method mStateResponseListener.onInsertRequestComplete(String indexName, InsertResponse response) will be triggered where the InsertResponse response will contain a count of the number of successful inserts. Or, after performing an information request on an index, the method mStateResponseListener.onInfoRequestComplete(String indexName, InfoResponse response) will be triggered where the InfoResponse response contains various method getters for returning state about the index such as its number of records.

    In particular, the Query class enables easy use of the sophisticated search power of the SRCH2 search server.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(Indexable firstIndex,
              Indexable... additionalIndexes)
        Initializes the state of the SRCH2Engine and prepares it for performing searches.

        This method should only be called once per application life-cycle such as when an instance of an activity requiring search is created (thus from the activity's onCreate method). Calling this method will not start the SRCH2 search server and must be called before any call to the method SRCH2Engine.onStart(Context context) is made.

        Callers must pass at least one Indexable to be searched on and can pass in as many as are needed.
        Parameters:
        firstIndex - an Indexable that must not be null
        additionalIndexes - any other Indexables that are defined

      • setAutomatedTestingMode

        public static void setAutomatedTestingMode(boolean isTestingMode)
        If JUnit or Android automated tests are to be run, calling this method and passing true will cause the SRCH2Engine to immediately stop the SRCH2 search server if it is running anytime SRCH2Engine.onStop(Context context) is called instead of waiting to do so after a delay.

        Developers performing automated testing should call this method before running any tests.
        Parameters:
        isTestingMode - toggles whether the SRCH2Engine should run in testing mode

      • onStart

        public static void onStart(android.content.Context context)
        Causes the SRCH2 search server powering the search to start.

        This method should be called anytime the activity requiring search functionality comes to the foreground and is visible--that is, when it can be interacted with by a user who might perform searches. Starting the SRCH2 search server is fast, usually taking under a second, and when it comes online and is ready to handle search requests the callback method onSRCH2ServiceReady() of the StateResponseListener interface, if implemented, will be executed and contain index and engine information. Checking whether the SRCH2 search server is ready can also determined by calling SRCH2Engine.isReady().

        A context is needed here to start the remote service that hosts the SRCH2 search server process. A reference to this context is not kept.
        Parameters:
        context - needed to start a remote service, any context will do

      • setSearchResultsListener

        public static void setSearchResultsListener(SearchResultsListener searchResultsListener)
        Registers the implementation of the interface SearchResultsListener for receiving the results of a search performed by the SRCH2 search server. This can be reset at anytime, and although it is not required to be set, it is the only way to get search results within the API.
        Parameters:
        searchResultsListener - the implementation of SearchResultsListener that will receive search results

      • setStateResponseListener

        public static void setStateResponseListener(StateResponseListener stateResponseListener)
        Registers the implementation of the interface StateResponseListener for receiving the state and status information about indexes and the SRCH2 search server. This can be reset at anytime, and although it is not required to be set, the callbacks of the StateResponseListener are useful for knowing whether inserts, updates or deletes were performed correctly, or, more importantly, when the SRCH2 search server comes online and is ready for search.
        Parameters:
        stateResponseListener - the implementation of StateResponseListener that will receive index and engine status and state information

      • searchAllIndexes

        public static void searchAllIndexes(String searchInput)
        Searches all Indexables that were initialized when included in the argument set of the method call SRCH2Engine.initialize(...); that is, this method makes searching all indexes at once easy.

        When the SRCH2 server is finished performing the search task, the method onNewSearchResultsAvailable(int HTTPResponseCode, String jsonResultsLiteral, HashMap> resultRecordMap) will be triggered. The resultRecordMap will contain the search results in the form of JSONObjects as they were originally inserted (and updated).

        This method will throw exceptions if the searchInput is null or if SRCH2Engine.initialize(...) has not been called; of if the value of searchInput is null or has a length less than one.
        Parameters:
        searchInput - the textual input to search on

      • searchIndex

        public static void searchIndex(String indexName,
               String searchInput)
        Searches the specific Indexable with the associated index name (that was defined in the IndexDescription that was returned by getIndexableDescription()).

        When the SRCH2 server is finished performing the search task, the method onNewSearchResultsAvailable(int HTTPResponseCode, String jsonResultsLiteral, HashMap> resultRecordMap) will be triggered. The resultRecordMap will contain the search results in the form of JSONObjects as they were originally inserted (and updated).

        This method will throw exceptions if the indexName is null or does not match any of the index names as defined by the corresponding Indexable's IndexDescription; or if the searchInput is null; or if SRCH2Engine.initialize(...) has not been called; of if the value of searchInput is null or has a length less than one.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index (defined in the IndexDescription of the Indexable) to search
        searchInput - the textual input to search on

      • advancedSearchOnAllIndexes

        public static void advancedSearchOnAllIndexes(Query query)
        Performs an advanced searches on all Indexables that were initialized when included in the argument set of the method call SRCH2Engine.initialize(...); that is, this method makes performing an advanced search on all indexes at once easy.

        When the SRCH2 server is finished performing the search task, the method onNewSearchResultsAvailable(int HTTPResponseCode, String jsonResultsLiteral, HashMap> resultRecordMap) will be triggered. The resultRecordMap will contain the search results in the form of JSONObjects as they were originally inserted (and updated).

        This method will throw exceptions if the query forming the advanced search is null; or if SRCH2Engine.initialize(...) has not been called; or if the value of query is null;
        Parameters:
        query - the formation of the advanced search

      • advancedSearchIndex

        public static void advancedSearchIndex(String indexName,
                       Query query)
        Performs an advanced search on the specific Indexable with the associated index name (that was defined in the IndexDescription that was returned by getIndexableDescription()).

        When the SRCH2 server is finished performing the search task, the method onNewSearchResultsAvailable(int HTTPResponseCode, String jsonResultsLiteral, HashMap> resultRecordMap) will be triggered. The resultRecordMap will contain the search results in the form of JSONObjects as they were originally inserted (and updated).

        This method will throw exceptions if the indexName is null or does not match any of the index names as defined by the corresponding Indexable's IndexDescription; or if the query forming the advanced search is null; or if SRCH2Engine.initialize(...) has not been called; or if the value of query is null;
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index (defined in the IndexDescription of the Indexable) to search
        query - the formation of the advanced search

      • insertIntoIndex

        public static void insertIntoIndex(String indexName,
                   org.json.JSONObject recordToInsert)
        Inserts the specified recordToInsert into the Indexable with the corresponding indexName as defined in the IndexDescription of that Indexable. This JSONObject should be properly formed and contain only keys matching the schema fields defined for the corresponding Indexable.

        When the SRCH2 search server completes the insert task, the method onInsertRequestComplete(String indexName, InsertResponse response) of the StateResponseListener will be triggered. Whether the SRCH2 search server was successful in inserting the record is signified by the value of the InsertReponse response's method getSuccessCount().

        This method will throw exceptions if the indexName is null or does not match any of the index names as defined by the corresponding Indexable's IndexDescription; or if SRCH2Engine.initialize(...) has not been called.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index (defined in the IndexDescription of the Indexable) to insert into
        recordToInsert - the JSONObject with keys matching the fields of the schema as defined in the corresponding Indexable to insert

      • insertIntoIndex

        public static void insertIntoIndex(String indexName,
                   org.json.JSONArray recordsToInsert)
        Inserts the specified recordsToInsert into the Indexable with the corresponding indexName as defined in the IndexDescription of that Indexable. This JSONArray should be properly formed and contain only the set of properly formed JSONObjects (that contain only keys matching the schema fields as defined for the corresponding Indexable).

        When the SRCH2 search server completes the insert task, the method onInsertRequestComplete(String indexName, InsertResponse response) of the StateResponseListener will be triggered. Whether the SRCH2 search server was successful in inserting the records is signified by the value of the InsertReponse response's method getSuccessCount().

        This method will throw exceptions if the indexName is null or does not match any of the index names as defined by the corresponding Indexable's IndexDescription; or if SRCH2Engine.initialize(...) has not been called.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index (defined in the IndexDescription of the Indexable) to insert into
        recordsToInsert - the JSONArray containing the set of JSONObjects with keys matching the fields of the schema as defined in the corresponding Indexable to insert

      • updateIndex

        public static void updateIndex(String indexName,
               org.json.JSONObject recordToUpdate)
        Updates the specified recordToUpdate in the Indexable with the corresponding indexName as defined in the IndexDescription of that Indexable. This JSONObject should be properly formed and contain only keys matching the schema fields defined for the corresponding Indexable. If the primary key of this record does not already exist in the index, it will be inserted; otherwise, the existing record will have its fields updated with the new values in the recordToUpdate.

        When the SRCH2 search server completes the update task, the method onUpdateRequestComplete(String indexName, UpdateResponse response) of the StateResponseListener will be triggered. Whether the SRCH2 search server was successful in updating the record is signified by the value of the UpdateResponse response's method getSuccessCount().

        This method will throw exceptions if the indexName is null or does not match any of the index names as defined by the corresponding Indexable's IndexDescription; or if SRCH2Engine.initialize(...) has not been called.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index (defined in the IndexDescription of the Indexable) to insert into
        recordToUpdate - the JSONObject with keys matching the fields of the schema as defined in the corresponding Indexable to update

      • updateIndex

        public static void updateIndex(String indexName,
               org.json.JSONArray recordsToUpdate)
        Updates the set of records contained in the recordsToUpdate in the Indexable with the corresponding indexName as defined in the IndexDescription of that Indexable. This JSONArray should be properly formed and contain only the set of properly formed JSONObjects (that contain only keys matching the schema fields as defined for the corresponding Indexable). For each JSONObject in the set, if the primary key does not already exist in the index, the record will be inserted; otherwise, the existing record will have its fields updated with the new values.

        When the SRCH2 search server completes the update task, the method onUpdateRequestComplete(String indexName, UpdateResponse response) of the StateResponseListener will be triggered. Whether the SRCH2 search server was successful in updating the records is signified by the value of the UpdateResponse response's method getSuccessCount().

        This method will throw exceptions if the indexName is null or does not match any of the index names as defined by the corresponding Indexable's IndexDescription; or if SRCH2Engine.initialize(...) has not been called.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index (defined in the IndexDescription of the Indexable) to insert into
        recordsToUpdate - the JSONArray containing the set of JSONObjects with keys matching the fields of the schema as defined in the corresponding Indexable to update

      • deleteFromIndex

        public static void deleteFromIndex(String indexName,
                   String primaryKeyOfRecordToDelete)
        Deletes the record with the matching primaryKeyToDelete in the index if it exists for the Indexable with the corresponding indexName as defined in the IndexDescription of that Indexable.

        When the SRCH2 search server completes the deletion task, the method onDeleteRequestComplete(String indexName, DeleteResponse response) of the StateResponseListener will be triggered. Whether the SRCH2 search server was successful in deleting the record is signified by the value of the DeleteResponse response's method getSuccessCount().

        This method will throw exceptions if the indexName is null or does not match any of the index names as defined by the corresponding Indexable's IndexDescription; or if SRCH2Engine.initialize(...) has not been called.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index (defined in the IndexDescription of the Indexable) to insert into
        primaryKeyOfRecordToDelete - the primary key of the record to delete

      • getRecordByIdFromIndex

        public static void getRecordByIdFromIndex(String indexName,
                          String primaryKeyOfRecordToRetrieve)
        Returns the record with the specified primaryKeyOfRecordToRetrieve if found in the index if it exists for the Indexable with the corresponding indexName as defined in the IndexDescription of that Indexable. When the SRCH2 search server completes the retrieval task, the method onGetRecordByIDComplete(String indexName, GetRecordResponse response) of the StateResponseListener will be triggered. The record retrieved will be in the form of a JSONObject inside the response GetRecordResponse.

        This method will throw exceptions if the indexName is null or does not match any of the index names as defined by the corresponding Indexable's IndexDescription; or if SRCH2Engine.initialize(...) has not been called; or if the value of primaryKeyOfRecordToRetrieve is null or has a length less than one.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index (defined in the IndexDescription of the Indexable) to retrieve the record from
        primaryKeyOfRecordToRetrieve - the primary key of the record to retrieve

      • getIndexInfo

        public static void getIndexInfo(String indexName)
        Performs an information task on the specified index for the Indexable with the corresponding indexName as defined in the IndexDescription of that Indexable. When the SRCH2 search server completes the information task, the method void onInfoRequestComplete(String indexName, InfoResponse response) will be triggered. The InfoResponse response will contain information about the index such as the number of records it contains or the time stamp of the last time the index was updated to reflect any pending changes.

        This method will throw exceptions if the indexName is null or does not match any of the index names as defined by the corresponding Indexable's IndexDescription; or if SRCH2Engine.initialize(...) has not been called.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index (defined in the IndexDescription of the Indexable) to get information on

      • onStop

        public static void onStop(android.content.Context context)
        Tells the SRCH2Engine to bring the SRCH2 search server to a stop. The SRCH2 search server will not halt immediately, but instead wait a short duration in case the user navigates back to the activity requiring search. In that case, the command to stop is cancelled. Since the SRCH2 search server is hosted by a remote service, a context is needed to stop this service. After calling this method, SRCH2Engine.isReady() will return false and no subsequent actions can be performed on the SRCH2Engine until SRCH2Engine.onStart(Context context) is called again. Pending tasks however, such as batch inserts, will not be interrupted and be allowed to finish.
        Parameters:
        context - needed to stop a remote service, any context will do

      • isReady

        public static boolean isReady()
        The engine need some time to load the index. During these windows the engine will not response for any write operations. For the search query, the engine keeps updating the last query and will automatically request the
        Returns:
        if the SRCH2 engine is ready or not.

      • setAuthorizationKey

        public static void setAuthorizationKey(String authorizationKey)
        Sets the authorization key that is required for the SRCH2 search server to perform any command or task.

        If this key is specified, each valid HTTP request needs to provide the following key-value pair in order to get the authorization. OAuth=foobar Example: curl -i "HTTP://localhost:8081/search?q=terminator&OAuth=foobar"

        If this key is not specified, it will be automatically generated by the SRCH2Engine.

        This method will throw an exception if SRCH2Engine.initialize(...) has not been called.
        Parameters:
        authorizationKey - the key that any request on the SRCH2 search server will have to supply in order for the SRCH2 search server to carry out the command or task
